project_descr: Iraq Crisis Response and Resilience is a programme that supports crisis response, and helps to strengthen resilience in Iraq.

outputs.output_descr:
Iraq Crisis Response and Resilience Programme (ICRRP)
-Socio-economic infrastructure restored/constructed  in refugee settlements 
-Greater economic opportunities created for Syrian refugees through sustainable employment

Improve institutional capacity of Joint Crisis Coordination Center (JCC) and Joint Crisis Management Center (JCMC) in crisis analysis, planning, response coordination with effective management capabilities under Component 1 with the DfID contribution.

UNDP aims to enhance self-resilience of the vulnerable populations in Syrian refugees,Internally Displaced Persons and host communities and self-sustainability of the institutions and mechanisms for basic service provision to the affected populations.

The project aims to enhance self-reliance of people in need and self-sustainability of government and community institutions, focusing on ICRRP Components of 2) Basic services and accountability; 3) Livelihoods recovery; and 5) Social cohesion.

Enhance socio-economic resilience for refugees, IDPs and host communities, including the new displaced from Mosul and create enabling conditions  to rebuilt people’s lives in newly liberated areas NLAs, funded under KfW agreement: 2016-18644 & 18818.
ICRRP-JapanFY2016 Immediate Stabilization and Resilience Building in Iraq-Phase II

Protection, Empowerment and Recovery Support for Syrian Refugees in Iraq
-Enhanced basic public services and economic opportunities for the refugees

outputs.output_title: Protection, Empowerment and Recovery Support for the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and Host Communities in Iraq.
outputs.output_descr: Protection, Empowerment and Recovery Support for the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and Host Communities in Iraq.
